text:
Created attachment 33968
sample workbook

The SUBTOTAL function is not ignoring nested subtotals when the second argument is specified as disjoint interval with the semicolon.

Sample case:
Cell | Contents
A1   | 1
A2   | =SUBTOTAL(9;A1)
A3   | =SUBTOTAL(9;A1;A2)


A3 should evaluate to 1, instead the result is 2. If the formula in cell A3 is written as =SUBTOTAL(9;A1:A2) the evaluation is correct (1).
I attach a simple workbook that reproduces the case.

Best regards,
    Luca
creator: lucamartini@tagetik.com
dominik.stadler@gmx.at
text: This was fixed via r1754674, previously it did not work for LazyRefEval, which "lost" the "isSubtotal()" information prior to being passed to the Subtotal class. We now look up this information as well to exclude those subtotals from the sum/avg/...
